column1: Stage 1: Converting textual data into xml
column3: Language optimized for textual data processing

column1: Stage 2: Filtering data based on the expert advice
column4: After expert’s conclusions were written up, an xml file was created

column3: Part of data processing was convenient in xslt. Interpolation using secondary splines. Existing java numerical libraries were used

column4:
Neural network library selected: joone
Network architecure selection library chosen: jgap

column3: Infering means transoforming the xml patients’ data into output data (conlusions), by using an engine and knowledge. Stage 5 shares the code with Stage 4.
Native xslt, java support (compiling, method developing)
Open, well documented. Capacity for distributed computing. Easy implementation of custom input/output layers
column4: Library has been modified by expanding with xml input data support

column3: svg is an xml expression of graphical objects. Transformation of xml data in svg by using xslt is natural.
Well defined standard. Capable of converting xml into any variation of xml.
column4: Objective was to create some appendixes and figures as xml->pdf conversion

column3: Closest implementation of xslt 2.0 (working draft). The author collaborates on defining the standard
Univarsal format. Large number of libraries and editors interpreting and checking the syntax compatibility.
